items.text: 142kph full into leg stump and he glances this away with easy behind square
138kph, back of a length outside off, he sits back and just pushes this to backward point
items.shortText: Rabada to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.preText: Richard: "Could they at least be pushing for twos rather than just singles?" They haven't been able to find the gaps
items.text: 116kph, slower ball, he bunts this short of backward point
items.shortText: Rabada to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: 140kph, low full toss, he pushes it past midwicket and the man misfields in the ring to allow a two!
140kph shorter outside off, he angles the face and runs this to third man with control
138kph low full toss, clips through midwicket
items.postText: Rajesh: "Bangladesh have scored 56 not-in-control runs today so far... the highest in any World Cup innings (since we started keeping ball by ball control stats) is 60."

items.text: Rabada drops it at deep backward square! It was a slower ball, he swung it away high to deep backward square, Rabada ran in initially and then had to turn and run backwards, he got both hands on it but dropped it and it bounced over the rope!
fuller, he pushes down the ground
slower ball, wide of off, he backs away and toes this down long on
134kph, back of a length outside off, he opens the face and runs to third man

items.preText: Waqas : "Really sad to see these fielding standards from SA . Once they had best fielding side in the world "
items.text: heaved through midwicket! It was a short ball again, he opened the hips up and slapped this hard along the ground to deep midwicket and beat the man on the rope with the power
items.shortText: Morris to Mosaddek Hossain, FOUR runs

items.text: smoked though cover-point! This was fuller outside off, he cleared the front leg again but reacted and threw his hands through the line, the timing was amazing to beat the point sweeper! He stood no chance!
items.shortText: Morris to Mosaddek Hossain, FOUR runs

items.text: 108kph slower ball outside off, punched to the man on the cover ring and they get one
wide slower ball, he reaches out and places this behind point for a couple

items.preText: This is Bangladesh's highest score against South Africa
items.text: short and wide, he cuts late but the man on the ring makes a superb save to prevent extra runs
high full toss outside off, surprises him as he misses, but it was below waist high
leg cutter slower ball but dragged way wide of off and called wide
he charges early, Phehlukwayo fires way too wide again! This was nearly off the cut strip. It was a knuckle ball
yorker, 127kph, on off, he turns this away to deep square, the throw from the deep hits the stumps at the striker's and it ricochets away fro another run!
109kph, slower ball, he backs away and lofts this inside out wide of long off, Duminy runs around and makes a diving save to prevent four
items.postText: 300 up to raucous applause from the Bangladesh fans

items.text: slower ball, he walks at the bowler and works the length to the gap at midwicket near the circle and they sprint an easy two
items.postText: Bangladesh's highest World Cup score is 322. Can they beat it?

items.text: full angled into middle, he rifles this wide of long on along the ground to pick up two more
glanced fine for four! He stepped outside leg, Morris followed with a shorter ball, he tried to pull, took one hand off the bat and got it fine and it raced to the rope!
heaved over deep midwicket! The man on the rope was 15m in, the swatted strike went flat and just over his head and landed inside the rope, one bounce four!
132kph, bouncer down leg and called wide!
